pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:5.1: 45. The training rule on breaking up a ball of food
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate by breaking up mouthfuls. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:7.2: “‘I will not eat by breaking up a ball of food,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:8.1: One should not eat by breaking up balls of food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats by breaking up balls of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:9.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:10.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
